alert.note: Alert for Greene; Pickens; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 03 at 6:49AM CST until February 05 at 1:43AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam affecting Pickens, Sumter and Greene Counties. .Heavy rainfall over the past 24 hours is producing rises along the Tombigbee River at Bevill Lock and Dam and levels are expected to rise into minor flood stage by this afternoon. A flood warning is now in effect for the Tombigbee River at Bevill Lock and Dam. Another statement will be issued by this evening, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam. * WHEN...From this morning to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 122 feet, Cattle in low-lying areas of Southern Pickens County should be moved to higher ground. Cattle are cutoff in lowlands of Southern Pickens County at stages above 122 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 120.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 122.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 122 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
